title: Xiaomi introduces AI-powered Mi TV 4A series with speech recognition
text:
Xiaomi introduces AI-powered Mi TV 4A series with speech recognition Xiaomi introduces AI-powered Mi TV 4A series with speech recognition By March 22, 2017 “Xiaomi’s new Android-powered TVs can be controlled by your voice” 
Xiaomi has launched its new Mi TV 4A series of televisions in its home market of China. The Android-powered TVs come with Patch Wall, a UI layer on top of Android, which is based on deep learning artificial intelligence. They come with a new Mi Bluetooth Remote that sports speech recognition with Sogou ASR speech recognition technology, which promises 97 percent accuracy. The new Xiaomi TVs also boast HDR 10 for clear picture quality. 
The Xiaomi Mi TV 4A comes in four screen sizes – 43-inch, 49-inch, 55-inch and 65-inch. The 43- and 49-inch variants offer full HD display, while the 55- and 65-inch models offer screens with 4K resolution. They are powered by 1.5GHz quad-core processors, mated to 2GB RAM and Mali 450-MP5 GPUs. 
They come with 32GB of internal memory, dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.2 LE, Mi Port, three HDMI 2.0 ports, AV, two USB 2.0 ports, Ethernet, Dolby Virtual Surround Sound, DTS and Bass Boost. The company is also offering standard variants of these TVs without AI, which come with 8GB of storage only. 
The Mi TV 4A 43-inch will be available starting at RMB 2,099 (~Rs 20,000), the 49-inch at RMB 2,599 (~Rs 24,700), the 55-inch at RMB 3,199 (~Rs 30,400), and the 65-inch model at RMB 5,699 (~Rs 54,200). They will go on sale in China starting March 2rd.
